column4: Question - is there a way I can set my Ubuntu desktop to automatically turn on at a certain time?
but doesn't that require a router that supports WOL?
then you can setup and automatic script on another computer on the same network to send the packet to wake the computer at the appropriate time
only a BIOS that supports WOL all routers do.
I thought only specific routers supported WOL
WOL is just a normal network packet...
is the computer you are trying to wake realtively modern?
sort of. pentium dual core, etc.

it's a file server for my parents. I began to question if it needs to run 247. I started to think, what if I just set it to run the entire day on sunday or something and have it auto shut down for the rest of the week. Then saturday night, fire back up so it's online for the automatic backup to kick over to it.
you'll haveto look through the bios for the feature
I'm just trying to be smart with what they need vs electricity savings.
their data doesn't change enough to warrant 247365 uptime, so meh.
at the same token I wonder if a pentium dual core is eating enough energy for it to even be a concern when idle.
I wonder, if a computer is in suspend mode if it would be able to wake up vs being completely turned off.
look at if the BIOS has an auto ON feature, even old ones have that feature.
